com.crawljax.core
Interface CrawlQueueManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
CrawljaxController
public interface CrawlQueueManager

This interface defines operations that can be used to add work to the queue and remove work from the crawlqueue.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
Stefan Lenselink

Method Summary
 void addWorkToQueue(Crawler work)
          Add work (Crawler) to the Queue of work that need to be done.
 boolean removeWorkFromQueue(Crawler crawler)
          Removes this Crawler from the workQueue if it is present, thus causing it not to be run if it has not already started.
 void terminate(boolean isAbort)
          Terminate this CrawlQueue, depending on the parameter issue a abort or a 'normal' terminate.
 void waitForTermination()
          Block (Wait) until all the work for this queue has been finished.
 

Method Detail

addWorkToQueue

void addWorkToQueue(Crawler work)
Add work (Crawler) to the Queue of work that need to be done. The class is thread-safe.

Parameters:
work - the work (Crawler) to add to the Queue

removeWorkFromQueue

boolean removeWorkFromQueue(Crawler crawler)
Removes this Crawler from the workQueue if it is present, thus causing it not to be run if it has not already started.

Parameters:
crawler - the Crawler to remove
Returns:
true if the crawler was removed successfully

waitForTermination

void waitForTermination()
                        throws InterruptedException
Block (Wait) until all the work for this queue has been finished.

Throws:
InterruptedException - when the blocking thread gets interupted.

terminate

void terminate(boolean isAbort)
Terminate this CrawlQueue, depending on the parameter issue a abort or a 'normal' terminate. A 'normal' terminate happens when the MaximumRunTime() or the MaxNumberOfStates is reached while a abort can be issues when an exception is catched and handled.

Parameters:
isAbort - true for abort, false for normal shutdown.
